p: Chromolaena squalida, Campomanesia sessiliflora, Myrsine guianensis, Matayba guianensis, Siparuna guianensis, Ocotea minarum and Endlicheria paniculata were selected for the screening of antimicrobial activity based on the criteria of large distribution/occurrence in the Cerrado biome, as well as organoleptic characteristics, focusing on plants with leaves that, when crushed, give off a remarkable fragrance. The species selected in the present study are representatives of the families Asteraceae, Myrtaceae, Primulaceae, Sapindaceae, Siparunaceae and Lauraceae.
